Key Arguments: The bill gives ACMA excessive power to silence information deemed false.
The state will control the interpretation and availability of information.
The bill threatens free speech and democratic rights by allowing the government to dictate truth.
Australians are capable of critical thinking and do not need government arbitration of truth.
The best remedy for misinformation is free and open debate.
The bill could suppress dissenting voices and enforce government narratives.
Notable Quotes: This amounts to state imposed sanitisation of all online information.
There is no place in Australia for such dictatorial shenanigans reminiscent of what happens in dictatorships such as China, Russia...
The best remedy for misinformation is always free and open debate.
It is a shocking assault on free speech and on our individual freedom of conscience and thought.
